meanings.definition: Not capable of being annulled or voided.
meanings.sent1: The contract was indefeasible, meaning it could not be canceled.
meanings.sent2: Her love for her family was indefeasible and unwavering.
meanings.sent3: The cat's claim to the sunny spot by the window was indefeasible, much to the dog's dismay.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed was as indefeasible as a mountain standing firm against the wind.
meanings.sent5: The knight's loyalty to his king was indefeasible, shining brightly through all challenges.

meanings.definition: Not subject to being lost or forfeited.
meanings.sent1: The title deed to the land was indefeasible, ensuring it could not be taken away.
meanings.sent2: Her friendship was indefeasible, lasting through thick and thin.
meanings.sent3: The student's claim to the last cookie was indefeasible, leading to a playful tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: The bond between the siblings was as indefeasible as the unbreakable chain of time.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact's historical value was indefeasible, preserving its significance for generations to come.

meanings.definition: Not able to be disputed or challenged.
meanings.sent1: The scientific evidence presented was indefeasible, leaving no room for doubt.
meanings.sent2: His reputation for honesty was indefeasible, earning him trust from all around.
meanings.sent3: The cat's claim to the title of 'best napper' was indefeasible, much to the amusement of the household.
meanings.sent4: Her logic was as indefeasible as the laws of nature, undeniable and solid.
meanings.sent5: The warrior's courage was indefeasible, inspiring all who witnessed his bravery.
